biography.value:
These airborne predators serve as assassins and sentinels for the core spawn. The terrible thrum of its insectoid wings and a chittering of mandibles announces an emissary’s arrival.

The core spawn emissary can expel clouds of crystalline spores from tubes in its head. These spores act like a contact poison and can be deadly if inhaled.

languages.custom: Telepathy 120 ft.,; understands Deep Speech but can't speak

description.value:
The emissary makes three talons attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: [[/damage 2d10 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The emissary emits a dreadful yet alluring hum. Each creature within 20 feet of the emissary that can hear it and that isn’t an &Reference[aberration]{aberration} must succeed on a [[/save con 14 format=long]] or be &Reference[charmed]{charmed} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

A 15-foot-radius cloud of toxic crystalline spores extends out from the emissary. The spores spread around corners. Each creature in the area must succeed on a [[/save con 14 format=long]] or become &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned}. While &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} in this way, a creature takes [[/damage 2d10 type=poison average=true]] damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Magic Resistance. The emissary has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
